I‚Äôm so proud of our elections officials. They‚Äôre doing a great job. And while it may take a little longer to count every vote, we‚Äôre used to that in Arizona. But here, we count every vote‚Äîsafely and securely‚Äîand we always will.

That‚Äôs what is happening right now: Ballots dropped off at polling locations are being counted just as they've done in previous elections. There has never been an issue, and there isn‚Äôt an issue today. Any ‚Äúcontroversy‚Äù is literally made up.

Here‚Äôs why the count in Arizona is taking some extra time: In our state, voters can drop off their mail-in ballots at polling locations on Election Day. Elections officials verify signatures on each ballot by hand, then count them. It takes time.

We‚Äôve proven that voting by mail is safe and secure‚Äîand makes it easier for everyone to participate in our democracy. 

Until President Trump started losing Arizona, that has never been a question.

For many years now, Arizona has been a real leader in early voting. We‚Äôve been voting by mail since the 1990s‚Äîit was started by a Republican governor and a Republican legislature and it has earned strong, bipartisan support for decades now.

That's a wrap on my 15th Annual #KansasConservationTour!
¬†
It was great to see the work happening in KS to be strong stewards of our land. Special thanks to @USDA_NRCS Acting Chief Kevin Norton for being w/ me on this tour and all those who joined us today. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EmF_PG_XYAA7GZE.jpg

üìçOur last stop is @NWKTC's Water Technology Farm in Goodland.
¬†
This public-private partnership w/ the college, students & local farmers allows the exploration & testing of water irrigation technology that could increase the efficiency of water use in #ag. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EmF9dq3WkAE3fMY.jpg

üìçWe're now at the @DucksUnlimited Wetland Reserve Easement Project in Thomas County.
¬†
Restoration of this 34-acre WRE is underway with the help of @USDA_NRCS & Ducks Unlimited. This site is important to protect biological diversity & it was great to hear about their progress. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EmFwAOHXYAAWvpQ.jpg

Smoky Valley Ranch also partners w/ the @KSForestService to assist with Prescribed Fire projects and I've been pleased to support these efforts to safely accomplish over 3,000 acres of prescribed fire treatments on the property.

üìçBordering Little Jerusalem Badlands State Park is Smoky Valley Ranch - our next stop.
¬†
Owned & operated by @nature_kansas, Smoky Valley Ranch has worked w/ @USDA_NRCS for 20+ years to protect grassland through grazing management plans. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EmFk6cMXUAMmh6t.jpg
It's also home to the largest population of Great Plains wild buckwheat, only found in the chalk bluffs prairie of western Kansas.

üìçOur next stop is the Little Jerusalem Badlands State Park owned by @nature_kansas.¬†
¬†
The Nature Conservancy has partnered w/ @KDWPT to make portions of this 332-acre area open to the public, showcasing the dramatic chalk rock formations visible in the photos below. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EmFLpPkXgAE9NF4.jpg

üìçOur first stop on my #KansasConservationTour is the Sheridan 6 Local Enhanced Management Area (LEMA).
